federation.info: After Tigran Petrosian became World Champion in 1963, a rapid growth of chess took place in Armenia. Many parents began taking their children to chess groups. Chess was also experiencing strong development in the Ararat region.

contactsInfo.trainersDescription: For admission or questions related to any branch, you can call the trainer of that branch.

LinedItems: There are 8 branches operating in the communities of the Ararat region, where more than 600 children attend chess classes.
10 trainers work in the chess schools of the Ararat region Chess Federation, passing on their experience and knowledge to future generations.

rating.ratingTableTitle: Rating Table of the Ararat Region Chess Federation
rating.descriptionChunk1: *The data is taken from the Armenian Chess Federation website.

If the problem persists, try to contact our technical grandmasters
